text: "My Boo" is a duet by American singers Usher and Alicia Keys. It was written by Usher, Keys, Jermaine Dupri, Adonis Shropshire, and Manuel Seal. It was produced by Dupri. The song is a hip hop track. It was included in the re- release of Confessions (2004). It was given positive reviews and won several awards. The song was released as the album's fourth single in 2004. The single stayed on top of the Billboard Hot 100 for six weeks. This became the third most-successful single from the album after "Yeah!" and "Burn". It was also ranked as the 36th biggest song of the 2000-2009 decade in the US. ==Track listing== *;UK CD 1 #"My Boo" #"Confessions Part II" #"Confessions Part II ==Charts== === Weekly charts === Chart (2004–2005) Peak position scope="row" scope="row" scope="row" Canada (Nielsen SoundScan) 1 Canada CHR/Pop Top 30 (Radio & Records) 4 scope="row" scope="row" scope="row" scope="row" scope="row" scope="row" scope="row" Romania (Romanian Top 100) 56 scope="row" scope="row" scope="row" scope="row" scope="row" scope="row" scope="row" scope="row" === Year-end charts === Chart (2004) Position Germany (Official German Charts) 92 Netherlands (Dutch Top 40) 67 Netherlands (Single Top 100) 94 Switzerland (Schweizer Hitparade) 57 UK Singles (Official Charts Company) "Confessions Part II" / "My Boo" 56 US Billboard Hot 100 24 US Hot R&B;/Hip- Hop Songs (billboard) 28 Chart (2005) Position Switzerland (Schweizer Hitparade) 69 US Billboard Hot 100 54 US Hot R&B;/Hip-Hop Songs (billboard) 35 Chart (2019) Position Portugal (AFP) 2486 ===Decade-end charts=== Chart (2000–09) Position US Billboard Hot 100 36 US Hot R&B;/Hip-Hop Songs 77 ===All-time charts=== Chart (2018) Position US Billboard Hot 100 200 == References == == Other websites == *My Boo at Discogs Category:2004 songs Category:2000s ballads Category:Usher songs Category:Alicia Keys songs Category:Billboard Hot 100 number one songs Category:Rhythm and blues ballads
